body:
Thank you for your comment.

Currently, doccano supports "Approve Labels" feature in #258 by @c-w. It enables admin users to approve labels. So, we may be able to implement your feature by extending it. 

Idea:

* Currently, the User model and Document model have a one to many relationships.
* By extending it to many to many, a document can have multiple approval information.
* Using it, doccano will control annotation status per user.

I guess you know best about a way to implement this feature, but I would be worried about changing the relation between user and document model. Since this will probably affect not only the status of document, but also statistics page. How would you differentiate document which has been approved by 1 person or multiple people?

At the moment what I like about the tool is simplicity. From experience the annotators are usually knowledgeable in their domain but not that skilful in technical terms. So presenting them with multiple buttons, 1 to mark item as finished (which they need to click all the time) and another one which is "next" might cause some confusion.

I would like to back the feature request. 
Due to limited annotator resources we practically always try to create data-sets filled with predicted pre-annotations. This tends to significantly speed up the actual annotation process. I quite like doccano but using it in this scenario is next to impossible, since when all entries are marked as completed you never know which entries are really - manually - annotated,

---------
In the context of sequence labeling projects, some documents may contain no interesting sequences. We'd like to be able to mark these as "done" to distinguish between documents  that have been reviewed and contain no spans vs. documents in need of review.

labels.name: duplicate

issue.body:
For sequence labeling projects, sometimes you have no matches in the document and that's absolutely correct.
You should be able to mark them as complete and see that they are completed.

Instead of displaying the number of marked occurrences (zero or non-zero), one should mark them as complete when they are marked by annotator as complete.

Also see #280

issue.body:
To add more annotations, you need to list unannotated documents.
How to do this quickly?
And if new documents were added by active learning and have annotations?

So adding an option to show only unapproved documents should help.
And you need to save the sorting.
Then you will be also able to refresh the page and see new unannotated documents.

---------

rename.from: Annotation status on pre annotated data and status management
rename.to: Clarify document's annotation status and filter by it.

body:
Discussion point.

Annotation status may be...

* Not annotated
* Annotated
  * but need confirmation (bookmark?)
  * but not approved
Also "automatically annotated" and "manually annotated" are different states.

So if the process is:
(doc received by annotator) -> check up the markup -> set correct or incorrect -> 
(doc received by verifier) -> check up the markup -> set correct or incorrect -> done.

Then the list of possible states should be:
 - no annotations / has annotations (if anyone still wants this -- you know it's flawed when docs with no annotations are correct, e.g. for NER, or sequence labeling)
 - automatically annotated / not annotated (a filter for annotator input)
 - not marked as correct / marked as incorrect / marked as correct. (by annotator)
 - not verified / verified / verified as incorrect (by verifier)
If the annotator is also a verifier, they can check "mark as complete" or "mark as complete and verified" -- to trigger bookmarking when it's not verified.
Or we can have additional personal bookmarking for revisiting the bookmarked list later.
(I would also add a kind of document priorities or subsets... currently, they can be handled with projects with the same labels, which is not very good implementation, but at least it's doable right now.)

Also, annotators needs to find the annotated documents, and verifiers -- to find the marked as correct but not verified documents.

P.S.
After considering all this... I would just separate widgets in a different project, and make my own frontend and backend for my process -- it will be much easier than "one size fits all" approach applied currently.

issue.body:
**UPD: Not updating since 1.1.0 (26 January 2021).**

Good day!

Thank you for your GREAT work!

I have some enhancement requests... Just for a note, maybe. I will update them permanently.

1. ~URLs should become to a corresponding state. On Dataset page, URL is `/projects/4/dataset`. But refreshing the page redirects to `/projects/4` (#595; implemented in #897; see also #992, 976).~
2. ~Pagination, "rows per page" should change URL (#595; also mentioned in #540, #578; implemented in #897). And moreover: every view state should have its own URL.~
3. Put label hints and key shortcut hints back to Annotation page (#635 (merged in non-equivalent #834); mentioned in #509, #627, #776, #991, #1035; see also #829, #834).
4. Show number of imported rows (#1078).
5. Show number of deleting rows only in confirm dialog. It's difficult to delete many rows (#1077).
6. ~Add First/Last pagination links (#615; implemented in #981).~
7. ~IMHO menu should be opened on Project page and/or subpages by default (implementated in #598).~
8. Make limits configurable (#708, #1119, #1124; mentioned in #514 (merged to #521), #575, #706, #853, #1175).
9. Removing rows freezes page. Could it be improved? (#523, #631; implemented in #1115)
10. ~Add importing of Excel and CoNLL files to UI (#650; implemented in #872; mentioned in #847).~
11. Use API error's messages in UI instead of common error messages (#601 (merged in non-equivalent #521)). More concrete importing file's validating errors (mentioned in #521). About login error messages: #910, #739, #911. Other errors: #913, #920, #923, #924, #972, #1052. See also: #485; #521; #150, #157; #651, #723, #23, #1052.
12. ~Use Alpine versions of ~Nginx,~ Node and Python (Docker)? (declined in #659 but then implemented in #795 and partially reversed in #1110; maybe a bad idea, see:  docker-library/docs#904, pypa/manylinux#37; see also #794, #1112).~
13. ~Localize roles and document types in UI (#605; mentioned in https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/976#issuecomment-692186583; implemented in #976).~
14. ~Current number of documents on annotation page should be updated on each annotation (mentioned in #594; implemented in #897).~
15. ~Show current user name (#604; implemented in #664;  improved by #680).~
16. Implement project edit page (#1080; see also #1114).
17. ~Allow digits as annotation keys (#599; implemented in #603).~
18. Hide unaccessible abilities from UI (#922; mentioned in #920, #866 (implemented in #916), #920, #924, #927).
19. ~Show import/export labels format (#591; implemented in #651).~
20. ~Allow to import unlabeled datasets (#658; implemented in #861; mentioned in #516, then merged to #521).~
21. ~On Statistics page, show documents per user statistics, also (in addition to labels per user) (#486; implemented in #678).~ See also p.58.
22. ~Make documentation for: superuser's password changing. (#628; implemented in #856; see also #622).~
23. ~On project's subpages, display project's name (#621; implemented in #691).~
24. ~Incorporate API client (https://github.com/afparsons/doccano_api_client, https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/299#issuecomment-557037552; doccano/doccano-client#3).~
25. "Approved" filter (#725, merged to #505, has been merged to #280); #1060.
26. Display user's current role (#881; mentioned in https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/758#issuecomment-626325760).
27. Display label `id`s column on Labels page alongside their names (#813, merged to #816).
28. Provide a setting: the order of labels (#816; mentioned in #1028).
29. Import datasets using doccano's exported files (#482; implemented in #958; see also #826, #848, #889, #961, #1015).
30. Implement "view only" role (#413; implemented in #430).
31. Implement dataset import using JSON (#454; implemented in #777).
32. Each annotator sees how many documents are being annotated in the project, by him (#830).
33. For each project, introduce a property: minimal number of annotations (of a given document) to indicate the document as "done" (#831; #947; see also #114).
34. ~Allow annotation approvers to change annotations (#703; implemented in #766).~

36. Implement document filters: by labels and annotators (#839 (merged in non-equivalent #280)).
37. Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed, in production (#857; see also #748).
38. Set `-x` and `-e`, `-u` on each Bash script (#860).

40. Document and/or minimize production and development difference (#810; mentioned in #925).
41. Align component versions (#870; implemented in #842). Upgrade component versions.
42. Implement an option: confirmation button on Annotation page (declined in #869; mentioned in #477).
43. Implement label groups (#5, #877 (merged in non-equivalent #477); see also #461, #477, #829, #635, #869).

Thanks!

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote 👍 related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show 👍 if someone upvote, and 🤩 means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 👍
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 👍
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 👍
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 👍
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 👍
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 👍
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 🤩
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 👍
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 👍
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 🤩
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 🤩
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 👍
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 👍

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 🤩
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 👍
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 👍
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 👍
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 👍
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 👍
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 👍
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

issue.title: How to filter for sentances marked as Checked?

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Hi, I am using doccano since a few days now where some colleagues are annotating the sentences and I mark them from non-checked to checked for the ones I judge good. 

Now, my question is how to filter for checked ones only? The Done / Undone filter only shows sentences in sequence labeling that have at least one annotation / no annotation. Is there such a filter? If not, what is then the purpose of checked / non checked? If no such a filtering feature, can I do the query through the DB? If yes, how?

Thank you in advance. I really appreciate your work on doccano, a great tool.

*   Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
*   Python Version Used: Python 3.8.5
*   When you install doccano: Last week
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Docker

body:
Is there any news about this? We are using pre-annotated data as well with the same problems, everything is marked as complete from the beginning and it is difficult to continue annotating, especially with multiple users.

We are now using the "approve" function, but this does not work very well. There is no way to filter for examples that haven't been approved yet or just jump to the next example that isn't approved.

It is also very difficult to keep track of progress as all the statistics show full progress. Also from the dataset view you cannot determine if an example is approved or not.

It would be great if an example would only be marked as done if you actually add/change an annotation or mark the example as approved.But, being able to filter for non-approved examples would solve most of these issues (ideally also in the statistics).

issue.title: [Enhancement] Add state model

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
# Problem

The completion of the document has been decided by whether it has at least one annotation. There is no explicit way to specify the document is complete and this is problematic especially for the sequence labeling project.

This PR adds the `ExampleState` model to store the document state.

Related to https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/280.

issue.title: Display a check button even for annotators

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body: ## Issue https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/280 ## What this PR do - display check button for all roles including annotator. - when the check button is clicked, confirm API is called and an example_state record is created. - separate confirmation status for each user. - when a project.collaborative_annotation is True, share status by each role. ### Before - Check button was hidden when user is annotator. - The same status was shared by approver and admin. ### After When project.collaborative_annotation is False - Each user has an independent example state. When project.collaborative_annotation is True - Each role has an example state. ## Screenshot Check button is displayed even if user is annotator. ## Next action idea - Display the example status in the annotation screen or dataset page. - Approver should want to know the example annotation is completed. - Fix filter results - If Done is selected, examples confirmed by annotator will be filtered. - Change graph displayed on the statistics page. - Delete the current completed/Incompleted graph. - Added graphs of completed/uncompleted annotations and completed/uncompleted approvals.

issue.title: Update progress graph of statistics

repository.name: doccano

issue.body: This PR is based on #1473. The new commits are 7787295 and later. ## Issue - https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/280 ## What this PR do - Change the graph displayed on the statistics page. - Add graphs showing the percentage of examples confirmed by the user for each role. - The current progress graph will be complete if the example contains at least one annotation. ## Screenshot ### before ### after
